etymology.interpretation: Depicts the impression of an animal’s paw—pad and toes—hence the senses “to trample” and “footprint.” As a component it conveys the idea of animal tracks or trampling, despite superficial resemblance to parts of other characters.

examples.chinese: 雪地上留有兽禸(雪地上留有獸禸)。
examples.pinyin: Xuědì shàng liú yǒu shòu róu.
examples.english: Animal footprints remain on the snow.

examples.chinese: 猎人循禸而行(獵人循禸而行)。
切莫禸幼苗(切莫禸幼苗)。
